content: I am currently a Master’s student in Computer Science department at UMass. My research interest is in computer vision, especially, object recognition in self and weakly supervised manner. I am also interested in latent variable models and generative models as means to better understand weak supervision cases.
summary: I am currently a Master’s student in Computer Science department at UMass. My research interest is in computer vision, especially, object recognition in self and weakly supervised manner. I am also interested in latent variable models and generative models as means to better understand weak supervision cases.
title: Wonho Bae

summary: Due to a lack of information that small region of interest contains, detecting small objects is still challenging problem. We improved the performance of small object detection through super-resolving the features of small objects to be similar to those of large objects. We investigated direct supervision using target features helps super-resolution only if they are properly extracted in terms of relative receptive field. We proposed a super-resolution model that can properly extract target features so that the features of small objects can be efficiently super-resolved, and as a result, they help better detect small objects. Our proposed method significantly improved the performance on various object detection datasets, especially for small objects, regardless of backbone strucutres.
title: Better to Follow, Follow to Be Better: Towards Precise Supervision of Feature Super-Resolution for Small Object Detection
